newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico CPI inflation 0.71 pct in first-half August.
newsitem.headline: Mexico CPI inflation 0.71 pct in first-half August.

text.p: Mexico's consumer price index in the first half of August rose 0.71 percent compared with the second half of July, Banco de Mexico said Thursday.
It said it was the lowest two-week level of inflation since December 1994.
Banco de Mexico said the price index of the government's basic basket of consumer goods rose 0.95 percent in the same period.
The central bank said the overall price index increase was chiefly due to higher prices for eggs, gasoline, domestic gas, local telephone service, electricity and various fruits and vegetables.
